dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 5786 IH: To establish in the National Nuclear Security Administration a Cybersecurity Risk Inventory, Assessment, and Mitigation Working Group.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Carbajal (for himself, Mr. Bacon, and Mr. Gallagher) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To establish in the National Nuclear Security Administration a Cybersecurity Risk Inventory, Assessment, and Mitigation Working Group.

section.header: Cybersecurity Risk Inventory, Assessment, and Mitigation Working Group
section.text: Subtitle A of title XXXII of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2000 (Public Law 106–65) is amended by adding at the end the following new section:

section.header: Cybersecurity Risk Inventory, Assessment, and Mitigation Working Group

subsection.text: There is in the Administration a working group, to be known as the Cybersecurity Risk Inventory, Assessment, and Mitigation Working Group.

Members of the working group shall include the Deputy Administrator for Defense Programs, the Associate Administrator for Information Management and Chief Information Officer, and staff from other offices as determined appropriate by the Deputy Administrator and Associate Administrator.

The working group shall prepare a comprehensive strategy for inventorying the range of National Nuclear Security Administration systems that are potentially at risk in the operational technology and nuclear weapons information technology environments, assessing the systems at risk, and implementing risk mitigation actions. Such strategy shall incorporate key elements of effective cybersecurity risk management strategies, as identified by the Government Accountability Office, including the specification of—

paragraph.text: goals, objectives, activities, and performance measures;
necessary resources needed to implement the strategy over the next ten years; and
detailed milestones and schedules for completion of tasks.

Not later than 120 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the members of the working group shall provide to the congressional defense committees a briefing on the plan of the working group plan to develop the strategy required under subsection (c).
Not later than April 1, 2025, the working group shall submit the congressional defense committees a copy of the completed strategy.

subsection.text: The working group shall terminate on the date that is five years after the date of the enactment of this section.
